title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed one goal in Boston Bruins' 2-1 win against the Carolina Hurricanes, responding well after coach Marco Sturm rotated goalies.
Marco Sturm gave Joonas Korpisalo consecutive starts, citing workload and Swayman's poor performance against Ottawa, which resulted in a 7-2 loss.
Despite the rotation, Swayman maintains better season stats than Korpisalo, with a higher save percentage and more goals saved above expected.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Bregman, Rob Refsnyder, and Dustin May expected to become free agents as MLB free agency begins.
Trevor Story and Lucas Giolito have contract options; Giolito may receive a $22.025 million qualifying offer.
Red Sox interested in upgrading starting rotation, first and second base, possibly targeting several top free agents.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty to call his third Patriots game this season for CBS, previously covering Miami and Tennessee matches.
Patriots, led by Drake Maye, boast a 6-2 record, with Maye emerging as a potential MVP candidate.
McCourty joined by Charles Davis and Andrew Catalon, notes surprise at Patriots' improvement since previous seasons.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are reportedly interested in trading for Miami Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips.
The Dolphins, struggling at 2-7, are seeking at least a third-round pick for Phillips ahead of the trade deadline.
Phillips, 26, has regained form after an Achilles injury and ranks 11th in pressures among edge rushers this season.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins defenseman Mason Lohrei has been scratched for three consecutive games as Boston continues their winning streak.
Coach Marco Sturm suggests Mason Lohrei should be frustrated over not playing, emphasizing it's a learning period for him.
Lohrei struggled defensively alongside Charlie McAvoy, with Boston outscored 10-7 during their 5-on-5 ice time together.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Falcons enter Sunday's game against the Patriots with a 3-4 record, aiming to ignite a playoff run.
Quarterback Michael Penix faces challenges in outdoor games, struggling with a 65.5 passer rating in such environments.
Bijan Robinson, leading the NFL in scrimmage yards per game, poses a dual-threat challenge for the Patriots' defense.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hit a two-run single in the third inning, giving the Dodgers a 3-0 lead in Game 6.
Kiké Hernandez made a decisive play, catching a fly ball and throwing out a runner to end the game.
The Dodgers beat the Blue Jays 3-1, forcing a Game 7 in the World Series with contributions from former Red Sox players.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff handed out candy on the T with Wizard of Oz and pirate costumes, including Pari Kim as 'T princess.'
Boston Children's Hospital hosted Jayson Tatum, who encountered a surprise during his visit on Halloween.
A 4-year-old Newton boy wore a McDonald's-inspired costume, while Boston siblings dressed as 'DunKings' caught attention.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A $50,000 winning Powerball ticket purchased at New Capital Farms in Marlborough, Massachusetts remains unclaimed since November 2024.
The deadline to claim the Powerball prize is November 20, one year from the original drawing date.
If unclaimed, the prize will be distributed across Massachusetts' 351 cities and towns by lottery officials.

title: W. Va. couple had their dream Halloween wedding in Salem
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Thaddeus and Danielle Martin from West Virginia wed on Halloween in Salem's Willows Park.
The bride wore black attire and carried black and red flowers during the Salem ceremony.
Justice of the Peace Penny Richards officiated while WBZ's Jay Willet recorded the event for media.
